reviews.text: Very nice waiter he has beautiful hair and a lovely affect. There was also a beautiful container for the dumplings.

Some of the best crispy beef slices I have ever had! All of the items we had were delicious - the beef, sliced pork belly with mashed garlic, and the chicken with black truffle soup dumplings. Weâ€™ll definitely be back when weâ€™re back to NYC, and recommending this place to everyone that visits

Used to be my favorite spot for Chinese food but they changed the menu and it seems like a down grade to me. The best iconic dishes like tea pork belly and green onion beef slices were removed and replaced by generic heavy sauce sautÃ© dishes. Also tasted like too much MSG than before. Hope they go back to the previous tasty level. I might not be back even though I visited 10+ times. Itâ€™s so sad.

ä½æ–¼ç´ç´„å”äººè¡—çš„ Jiang Nan NYC å°‡æ±Ÿæµ™èœæ¼”ç¹¹å¾—æ—¢ç²¾ç·»åˆä¸å¤±å®¶å¸¸å‘³ï¼Œé¤é»æ–°é®®ã€å£æ„Ÿå±¤æ¬¡åˆ†æ˜ã€‚æ»‘ç‚’ç‰›è‚‰ä¸Šæ¡Œå‰ä»¥éŒ«ç®”ç´™åŒ…è¦†é»ç«ï¼ŒèŸ¹è‚‰ç‚’è›‹æ‹ç…§å¾Œé‚„æœ‰æ¡Œé‚Šæ‹Œé£¯æœå‹™ï¼Œæ¯é“æ–™ç†éƒ½å¸¶ä¾†å°é©šå–œã€‚ç‚¸è±†è…å¤–é…¥å…§å«©ï¼Œçµ²ç“œæ¸…ç‚’å‰‡æ¸…çˆ½å¯å£ï¼Œæ•´é«”é¢¨å‘³å‡è¡¡è€Œä¸æ²¹è†©ã€‚é¤å»³è£æ½¢ä½èª¿å„ªé›…ï¼Œç‡ˆå…‰æŸ”å’Œã€éŸ³æ¨‚èˆ’é©ï¼Œç‡Ÿé€ å‡ºæ”¾é¬†ç”¨é¤æ°›åœã€‚æœå‹™å¾ˆä¸éŒ¯ï¼Œæœå‹™äººå“¡è¦ªåˆ‡ä¸”ç´°å¿ƒï¼Œé»é¤ã€ä¸Šèœåˆ°æ¡Œé‚Šæ‹Œé£¯éƒ½æœ‰å‘¨åˆ°å®‰æ’ï¼Œè®“æ•´å€‹ç”¨é¤éç¨‹é †æš¢æ„‰å¿«ã€‚ç„¡è«–æ˜¯å®¶åº­èšé¤ã€æƒ…ä¾¶ç´„æœƒï¼Œæˆ–æƒ³åœ¨ç´ç´„å“åšç²¾ç·»æ±Ÿæµ™æ–™ç†çš„é¥•å®¢ï¼ŒJiang Nan NYC éƒ½æ˜¯å€¼å¾—æ¨è–¦çš„é¸æ“‡ã€‚

We got pumpkin, wagyu, and classic pork dumplings, wagyu noodles, duck spring rolls, passionfruit tea, and mangosteen lychee tea. We were blown away at how delicious the cabbage with chili oil was, and it's complimentary when you sit down. We're trying to figure out how to make it at home because we need it in our lives but can't drive down to NYC often lol. Everything was absolutely delicious!! The staff were super nice, especially when my fiance accidentally spilled his drink on the floor.

The menu is on an tablet they give you. All the items have pictures, which is super helpful! And you can add things to your cart like you're shopping. You send it to the kitchen and a server comes and confirms the order with you.

Definitely coming back here!

Attentive servers, fast time between ordering and food brought to the table. We went as a party of 3 with no prior reservation and was seated within 10 minutes. Decor very dark. The lights flickered noticeably and strangely. Liked the food thought it was a bit overpriced.
all good
Amazing food! Soup dumplings, pork belly, ribs, duck! Our server was so great- funny and he gave great food suggestions.
Staff is super friendly and the food is great! Recommend the soup dumpling
Igor is a GREAT barman. Made our day, but the food is also brutally good. Soup dumpling is not to be missed. Ask for the chili oil.

We visited New York City and stumbled upon this restaurant. We ordered the Peking duck and sauerkraut dish, which were both delicious and of high quality. We highly recommend this place and will definitely be returning.

Odd experience but food was tasty, we sat down and not explained that the menu was on the iPad and we ordered using that. It was in a confusing order skipping from the starters to the mains to starters and had extra pages but couldnâ€™t order from them. Not sure this would work in many places. Portion sizes were smaller than I expected and not much option for noodle dishes. We had a â€œsizzlingâ€ beef dish which arrived in tinfoil and then set fire to. Very expensive for what it was
Excellent food, friendly and efficient service. Would highly recommend.
Jiang Nan was delicious!! Great dim sum and great drinks!!
Excellent food, wagyu noodles and soy braised chicken were delicious

Spectacular. Will recommend this to everyone.

Menu is ample. Every single item was outstanding. Flavorful but subtle. Ideal portions. Price is beyond fair, cheap for the superb quality.
Iâ€™ve been here a few times and still love it a lot! As a Chinese, I think itâ€™s one of the places in NY to get the most authentic Chinese food. Would highly recommend the liver!!

This is a nice fancy restaurant for me visiting the first ever time. The only thing that was not so great was the chicken with blueberry sauce. The texture felt a bit hard and I felt it needed to be cooked a little more. Otherwise, rest of the food was pretty appetizing.
Really Good Environment!
Hit the spot for good Chinese food! The crispy beef and wagyu dumplings were delicious.
Great food, service and atmosphere. The dumplings were outstanding.
MittelmÃ¤ÃŸige QualitÃ¤t zu deutlich Ã¼berhÃ¶hten Preisen, das Lokal selbst recht nett

Definitely on the pricier side but the food is totally worth it. Among the best Chinese food we had outside of China!! The staff was friendly and the ambiente and seating were comfortable. The food also came quickly! ^^

My husband and I had a 10/10 experience here. Visiting NYC from Denver, we wanted solid Chinese food and came across this place. It was absolutely delicious! As a vegetarian, I sometimes struggle with splitting things with my husband. Not here! We split the mushroom soup, which was huge and tasty, and the truffle tofu, which was perfectly hot and savory. He got the sliced beef and loved it. Would recommend it all! Also, the bartender, Igor, was super sweet and helpful, along with everyone on the staff being wonderful. Weâ€™ll absolutely be back!
Great food, great ambiance. Will come back for sure
Great food, great service but unfortunately the crazy loud, obnoxious club music they were blasting plus war images on CBS news running on the TV ruined our dinner.
It is a wonderful place for dinner and sharing. Prefect food,great service.
Incredible restaurant
Amazing food
Very Tasty food. Especially the duck with pancakes. Lovely for our last evening in NYC.
Amazing food!

Iâ€™ve been to Jiangnan numerous times with my friends. The service, food, and atmosphere are always outstanding. Today, we were served by Yizhou, who was incredibly patient with our orders and very attentive throughout the meal. Highly recommend Jiangnan for anyone looking for authentic and consistently great dining experiences.
Every piece of food was perfect. Love ordering on tablet. Bartender was great too. We had Peking duck and walnut prawns are top notch
Good
å¾ˆå¥½åƒ
One of the best Chinese spots I've been too!
Great food, great service and great people!  This place has flavors that'll change ya life.

TL;DR: Solid Sichuan-leaning spot in Chinatown. Spicy chicken wontons are a must. Braised beef tripe with potato is tasty but fatty. Milk-foam tea is smooth, not too sweet. Quick service and a clean room.

Found Jian Nan after a nearby viral place was overbooked. Got seated fast and food came out hot. I am not usually into dumplings but the soup dumplings here were really good. The Spicy Chicken Wontons were excellent as well, soft wrappers, sesame, good heat. Note the peanut element for anyone with allergies. The Braised Beef Tripe with Potato had deep flavor, but the meat leaned fatty for me, about 7.5 out of 10. Chicken Fried Rice was classic and not greasy. The Peach Oolong Tea with Milk Foam was balanced and refreshing.

Total was about $90 before tip for dishes and drinks. Fair for the quality and portions.

Pro tips:
â€¢ Order the spicy wontons and/or soup dumplings
â€¢ Skip the tripe if you prefer lean cuts.
â€¢ The milk-foam tea is worth adding.
â€¢ Expect around $25 to $35 per person.
Excellent Peking duck and vegetables and fried tofu
Sehr leckere Speisen, nettes Personal bei schÃ¶nem Ambiente. Wir wÃ¼rden wieder kommen.
Soup dumplings were great, thin skin!!!! Eel was the dish!!!
Loved our server, Ritta
Ritta was excellent! She has great recommendations and encouraged us to het out of our shells! The food and the service were both stellar!
The food was great! The staff is really friendly. Nice ambience.
Expensive,  small portion,  food is ok. Noisy atmosphere.
The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and friendly staff. The food was good, though not exceptional, and the prices were reasonable. Overall, itâ€™s a pleasant place to have a meal

This is hands down the BEST Chinese restaurant in NYC â€” and I donâ€™t say that lightly. If youâ€™re looking for truly authentic Chinese food, Jiangnan is the place. What makes it so special is that itâ€™s not limited to one region; here youâ€™ll find dishes from Beijing, Shanghai, Canton, and Sichuan, all executed beautifully.

On our most recent visit, we ordered some of our all-time favorites: æ¸…ç‚’ä¸ç“œ (stir-fried loofah), æ±Ÿå—å°ç¬¼åŒ… (soup dumplings), çº¢æ²¹æŠ„æ‰‹ (wontons in chili oil), è’œæ³¥ç™½è‚‰ (sliced pork belly with garlic sauce), æ¡‚èŠ±ç³¯ç±³è—• (sticky rice stuffed lotus root with osmanthus), é»‘æ¾éœ²è„†è±†è… (crispy tofu with black truffle), and é“¶è€³ç¾¹ (white fungus dessert soup). Every single dish was perfection â€” fresh, flavorful, and made with such care. The balance of flavors, the textures, and even the presentation always remind me of home-cooked meals but elevated to something unforgettable.

Jiangnan also holds a very special place in our hearts. When my husband and I were just dating, the very first family dinner with my mom happened here. Now, years later, after marriage and countless meals together, we just came back for what must be our 20th visit â€” again with my mom. The consistency and warmth of this restaurant have been part of our family story.

If you want an authentic, heartfelt Chinese dining experience in New York, this is your go-to spot. Jiangnan is not just a restaurant â€” itâ€™s a place where memories are made, one incredible dish at a time.

OMG the lab skewer is so juicy and it melts in your mouth. Dipping in the spicy chili powder on the side adds additional flavor to it. Highly recommend!

The jelly fish cold dish is a great appetizer to have while waiting for the entree. Pork liver were also very tender and juicy.

BTW, their Sichuan pickled cabbage is so addicting, spicy and sour, I just canâ€™t stop eating it.

We took our sons and parents to Jiang Nan NYC, and the experience was truly memorable. The food was absolutely fantastic â€” we ordered the duck along with several other dishes, and everything was incredibly fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Even our kids were so impressed they asked to come back again!

The ambiance was elegant but welcoming, and the service was excellent from start to finish. Itâ€™s easy to see why this restaurant is a Michelin recommendation â€” it definitely deserves the recognition. Jiang Nan is one of those places that lives up to the hype, and weâ€™re so glad we added it to our NYC food list. Highly recommend for anyone visiting Chinatown!

This is a place I know Iâ€™ll return to, just to relive the flavors of their Peking Duck (Half Duck), SautÃ©ed Eggplant in Spicy Garlic Sauce, and Bacon & Vegetable Fried Rice. Each dish was surprisingly well-balanced and thoughtfully seasoned. The duck had perfectly crisp skin and was bursting with flavor. The fried rice, though made with an unexpected mix of ingredients, came together in the most harmonious way. As for the eggplant, it was uniquely seasoned and definitely worth a try at least once.

The space feels both elegant and comfortable, making it ideal for a relaxed yet refined dining experience. Service was a bit inconsistent: one server was attentive and friendly, while another seemed less engaged when taking our order.

That said, this is the kind of place Iâ€™d happily bring someone special to a partner, a friend, family member, or even a business guest. It strikes a lovely balance between elevated cuisine and inviting atmosphere.

It is a very decent and authentic Chinese restaurant. They have fancy Chinese food with beautiful plating, most of which we can only get in China. Their Peking duck is very good. The other dishes like string beans and smoked pork are all very nice. Even the free appetizer picked cabbage is well made that I asked for refill. The servers are attentive. Overall definitely is one of the best Chinese restaurants in the city.

Spent a wonderful evening at Jiangnan! The foods are so good! My favorite are braised rice with black truffle and steamed lotus roots stuffed sticky rice. Amazing! My 2 friends and I would give them 5 stars out of five! Totally recommend this place. Oh we forgot to take picture of the black truffle rice.

Pretty solid Chinese food! We tried a few of their lesser-known dishes and were pleasantly surprised.
1) Sliced beef in golden peppercorn broth came in a big pot: the soup was perfect! just the right level of spiciness!
2) Stir-fried lotus root was a clean and light vegetarian optionâ€”not oily at all.
3) Sliced pork belly in garlic sauce was tasty, though a bit on the oily side (as expected with pork belly). Iâ€™d definitely come back. Only downside: the atmosphere inside can get a little too loud, even without music playing.

Exceeded my expectations on all fronts! Everything was great including the tea! Really appreciated the staff's diligence regarding dietary restrictions, making sure the items we ordered were without sugar added. When we paid I noticed the receipt even included comments alerting no sugar to the chef. How attentive! Loved the mushroom soup, stirred fried luffa and baby cabbage. We also got the grilled fish (barramundi) with garlic oil which was very flavorful. The truffle tofu was average. The tea was floral and complemented the food well. Highly recommend!

I stumbled upon this place and instantly fell in love with the vibe. Itâ€™s such a beautiful spot. warm, stylish, and inviting. We were seated right away, and the host greeted us with genuine friendliness. Our waiter came over almost immediately, explained the menu, and served us lemon water before we even had to ask. Ordering drinks through the tablet was surprisingly fun and easy. I went with the mixed fruit tea, while my boyfriend tried the rice wine. Both drinks were presented beautifully and tasted just as good as they looked.For food, we started with the pork dumpling soup, which was comforting and flavorful. The deep fried tofu was perfectly crisp on the outside, soft inside and very well seasoned. The kimchi fried rice were bold, tangy, and addictive definitely a must-try. To top it all off, we had the crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e for dessert, and it was flawless: creamy, smooth, with that satisfying caramelized sugar crack on top.Overall, this place struck the perfect balance of atmosphere, attentive service, and thoughtfully prepared food. Itâ€™s the kind of spot you can enjoy on a casual night out but still feels special. Highly recommend!

We had a really nice experience at Jiang Nan NYC. The quality of the food was excellent. Eeverything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully prepared. The service also was good and the staff were polite and professional.
We walked in on a Friday afternoon and had to wait about an hour since it was busy, which is understandable for a popular place. Still, Iâ€™d recommend making a reservation, especially for weekends or evenings.
Overall, a great spot with delicious food and a lively atmosphere. Would definitely come back!

I went to Jiang Nan for lunch today and ordered three dishes. Honestly, I was really disappointed.

The first time I ever tried the Jiang Nan brand was at their Flushing location in Queens, and that experience was amazing. The food quality, service, and overall management were top-notch. But coming to the Chinatown location in Manhattan today left me quite let down.

I ordered three dishes: a crab soup (with rice), a fried duck roll, and smoked pork. To be honest, these shouldâ€™ve been signature dishes, but for some reason, everything I had today tasted really fishy and off.

First, the crab soupâ€”it had such a strong fishy smell. After mixing it with rice, I took just one bite and couldnâ€™t continue. It was completely inedible for me. No one from the staff came to check in or ask how the food was, or if I had any concerns. That soup honestly made me feel sick.

As for the smoked pork, it tasted more like hamâ€”not at all like what I had in Flushing. The quality was just nowhere near comparable.

And then there was the environment. The lighting was extremely dim and gray, making it hard to even see the food on the table. Like, could they please do something about the lighting?

Lastly, the service was honestly not good. It didnâ€™t feel like the Jiang Nan I remembered. Overall, I can only give it three stars. Very disappointed. I wonâ€™t be coming back.

è èå•¤ä»ªå¼æ„Ÿæ»¡æ»¡ï¼Œä¸€å°æ¯ä¸€å°æ¯å–èµ·æ¥æ„Ÿè§‰å¾ˆæ£’ï¼

Came here for Peking Duck with the pancake wrapper because it's hard to find. Ordered the half duck, Crab&Pork Soup Dumplings, and Garlic Eggplant. Delicious! It was just enough and was so filling!

The tables around us had so many drinks in fun dispensers, like the pineapple beer, hot tea, and the cold sake! Will come back to try next time!

If you go to one Chinese restaurant while in NYC, make it this one. Everything was exceptional, from the food to the service to the atmosphere. The spicy pork belly with green peppers was one of the best Chinese dishes Iâ€™ve ever tried, and the bacon veggie fried rice was delicious too. Love the complimentary green tea as well. Overall, highly highly recommend Jiang Nan. Spectacular from start to finish!

One of the best Chinese experiences I've had in my life! Every dish was fantastic and the service was very good. The duck, tiger shrimp, and green beans were incredible. Soup dumplings are also a must. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Such a beautiful experience!! The duck was marvellous; It was fresh, wonderfully paired with accoutrements. Great service too- attentive yet not interfering. Definitely a celebration/ date night worthy restaurant.

This place is a lot of fun! Came here for a work team dinner and the staff were super accommodating for a larger group. Ordering via iPad was very handy and the food came out quite quickly. Would recommend the duck, it's served beautifully. Some of the dishes are quite performative too, which make for a fun meal.

Review | A Michelin-Recommended Gem for 3 Years Straight â€” The Pickled Chili Sea Bass is Next-Level!

Stumbled upon this incredible Sichuan restaurant that has earned Michelin recognition for three consecutive years (2022â€“2024), and honestly, it lives up to the hype!

Main Dishes: Pickled Chili Sea Bass & Spicy Boiled Beef
The highlight of the night was the Pickled Chili Sea Bass â€” served whole in a bubbling hot pot, with crispy skin and tender meat infused with that signature tangy, spicy flavor of pickled chilies. Itâ€™s bold, aromatic, and totally addictive. The broth is loaded with extras like lotus root, potato slices, enoki mushrooms, and wide glass noodles â€” all soaking up that glorious spicy flavor. The Spicy Boiled Beef (Shuizhuniurou) was equally impressive â€” juicy, flavorful beef in a numbing chili oil broth with plenty of veggies. Perfectly executed.

Drinks: Matcha Latte & Osmanthus Latte
After the heat, we cooled off with two surprisingly good lattes â€” the Matcha Latte had a strong green tea aroma and was topped with a beautiful matcha leaf design, while the Osmanthus Latte was lightly floral and soothing, with delicate dried osmanthus sprinkled on the frothy top. Both were creamy, balanced, and a perfect match for the spice.

Ambience & Service:
The three Michelin plaques on the wall immediately set the tone. The space is modern with tasteful Chinese elements, clean and cozy, and the staff were friendly and attentive.

Verdict:
If youâ€™re a spice lover or a fan of authentic Sichuan cuisine, this place is a must. The Pickled Chili Sea Bass alone is worth the trip. Add in great drinks and a solid atmosphere â€” itâ€™s easily one of my new go-to spots!

Had a great experience here. Make a reservation first, so that you donâ€™t have to wait at the front because this place is BUSY! The servers are quite attentive and want to make sure that your meal is okay. We got the salted egg yolk prawns and that was so incredibly delicious. The seafood fried noodles was also a great dish that my friend really liked. Finally, just look at that decor! My friend is an interior designer, and she was so happy. The prices also arenâ€™t too steep considering its Michelin star recognition. I would definitely come back and try some of the other dishes.

We had dinner at Jiang Nan and it was absolutely unbelievable! Every dish was packed with flavor and beautifully presented â€” truly some of the best food weâ€™ve had in a long time. Our server, Cao, was fantastic â€” attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. The whole experience was top-notch from start to finish. Highly recommend!
We will be back! Thank you!!!

Best Duck in town! Juicy, great taste and specially with that thin paper rice roll that not everywhere can achieve ğŸ˜ŠğŸ’¯
Soup dumplings are good too!

Excellent Peking Duck and dumplings!! The Peking duck was very crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The dumplings were very juicy and full of soup. 10/10 would recommend!! I would love to come back to this place again.

Typical excellent Chinese cuisine.
Waiting time at the bar with a beer was easy.

The Beijing duck I had was perfect.
The side dishes were great too.

Service was quick and easy.

Design is a mixture of modern and asian style.

Iâ€™ll come back!

ãƒ“ãƒ–ã‚°ãƒ«ãƒãƒ³æ²è¼‰åº—ï¼æ³¨æ–‡ã—ã¦ã‹ã‚‰æä¾›ã¾ã§ã®ã‚¹ãƒ”ãƒ¼ãƒ‰â—ï¼ç›®ç‰ã®åŒ—äº¬ãƒ€ãƒƒã‚¯ã¯ã¨ã£ã¦ã‚‚ç¾å‘³ã—ã„ï¼ãƒ“ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚‚ä¸€æ¯6ãƒ‰ãƒ«å¼±ã¨ã€ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚ºãƒŠãƒ–ãƒ«ãªå€¤æ®µå¸¯ï¼ãŠåº—ã®é›°å›²æ°—ã‚‚è‰¯ãã¦ã€æœ€é«˜ã®ãŠåº—ã§ã—ãŸï¼

I had been wanting to try this restaurant for years and finally had the chance. Love the decor, ambience and the ordering system.
It was very easy to find what I wanted to eat with the iPad and seeing visuals was helpful too.

I should preface by saying that I have had Peking duck all over the US and several countries in Asia. Many friends and family have recommended Jiang Nan to me specifically for the duck.

I was really disappointed in the Peking duck. Presentation was phenomenal. But the breast meat and the dark meat was dried out and only certain pieces of the skin were crispy. Even some of the cucumbers and scallions were dried out. With the half duck price point at ~50 dollars and full duck at ~100 dollars I donâ€™t think I would come here again.

Truffle soup dumplings and the salt and pepper duck bones were amazing though!

Ok this place is soooooooo good. I knew based on being 4.8 stars in NYC with 100's of reviews it was going to be a good experience, but I'm beyond impressed. Let's start with the service. Front of house has been impeccable. Courteous prompt service, good help navigating the expansive menu, tasteful decor and light piano music for atmosphere. All good. The dish presentation was also top notch. Didn't expect the show with the pineapple beer, but beyond being delicious, it's the kind of extra touch that makes a meal memorable.

On to the food. We started with the black truffle soup dumplings. Very nice and the burst of flavor makes it such a wonderful bite. We had marbled beef in golden soup and eggplant in garlic and pork sauce. The latter an excellent rendition of a classic Chinese dish, while the former was new to us and remarkable. Both with a tad of spice (we were cautioned, again great attention to guest comfort by front of house staff) our taste buds were singing by this time. We finished with the peach gummies for dessert, delicious light and perfect. Not to heavy or overly sweet. Top marks to back of house for delighting us too.

Bottom line, affordable indulgence, TEN stars.

I ordered pork&crab soup dumplings and marble beef with pepper broth. The food was so good, the pepper broth was sure spicy, but so addict. I went alone but everyone was so nice. Recommended for two people or more to try more dishes.

This restaurant exceeded all our expectations with outstanding food and service. The cumin lamb was perfectly seasoned and tender, while the eel showcased that refined regional preparation style beautifully. Everything we ordered was delicious, arriving quickly despite the busy atmosphere. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable, and the setting strikes a nice balance between casual and refined. Donâ€™t miss the cumin lamb and eel - theyâ€™re absolutely worth the visit. Highly recommended!â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

Great restaurant for everyone wanting to eat authentic and high quality chinese food.

It's a bit more on the expensive side but the interieur, the food and the quality of the servers definitely reflects that.

The portions are big, if youre there with a child you might want to ask for a slightly smaller portion (i dont know if its possible, but asking doesnt hurt).

If youre sensible to spicyness, respect the levels they put in the menue, they are quite accurate.

Can only recommend it.

Omg, guys! Iâ€™ve been craving something nice and Asian this week, and this spot is hands down the best in town so far. The food was simply amazing every little bite was perfect. We had the dumplings and duck, and honestly, even the table water tasted delicious. The service was high-class yet super friendly, and the fact that the restaurant holds a Michelin star just makes it even more special.

We weren't super hungry so we went for dumplings. They did not disappoint. We shared everything. We ordered the steamed pork and crab meat soup and dumplings, steamed black truffle and pork soup dumplings, and the steamed   wagyu tomato soup dumplings.  There were all unique and very good. I also ordered the kumquat lemon tea and a peach tea. The drinks were equally amazing. This place has won a Michelin star the last three years. Everything they brought out looked amazing. I only wished I had more of an appetite when I went. Absolutely amazing food amd drinks in a very nice dining area.

This Chinese restaurant truly lives up to its three Michelin stars â€” every dish we tried was a masterpiece. The dumplings were perfectly delicate and bursting with flavor, the soup was rich and comforting, and the Beijing duck was simply unforgettable â€” crispy skin, tender meat, and beautifully presented.

We also tried their pineapple beer, which was a surprisingly refreshing and delicious pairing with the food. The atmosphere added to the whole experience â€” elegant, welcoming, and thoughtfully designed.

If youâ€™re looking for an authentic, upscale Chinese dining experience, this place is an absolute must. I canâ€™t wait to go back!

Worth the Michelin value â€” every dish was delicious.
They have touch screens for ordering, which is very convenient, and the food came out quickly without much wait.

However, the service was a bit unorganized. The staff seemed unsure of their roles, which made things slightly confusing.

Also, you really need a reservation â€” otherwise, expect a long wait.

I see why they have Michelin stars. The food was fresh and the most delicious Sichuan I ever had. I ordered the chicken in chili sauce and stir fried grass fish. I had the cheesecake for dessert. This was an excellent birthday meal. I will definitely come back when I return to NYC. The service was also impeccable.
Here are my thoughts on the food. The service was good and the staff were polite. The restaurantâ€™s atmosphere was quite nice. The food was amazing. Definitely would recommend you visit here.

So excited to stop by the only Michelin recommended Chinese fusion restaurant and they did not disappoint! I think I loved every single dish

They have a location here in Chinatown and several others across the tri-state area and country. This is a seriously perfect meal if you like exploring different Chinese cuisines and dishes like me.

Must try the Peking Duck, the Braised Pork Belly, the Honey Walnut shrimp and Cumin Lamb

A great meal.  Maybe one of the most polished interiors for a Chinese restaurant.   This does affect the price a bit but very reasonable for the quality.   The food came out super fast and a remarkably great duck. I do think pineapple is an odd accoutrement with Peking Duck just eat it on the side.

What a pleasant great experience.  We were just walking by and decided to enter. The service top notch, food is tasty, atmosphere great.  We tried pineapple beer, that's something new,pleasant surprise. Fried fish was so delicious. Next time we will try Peking duck.

JiangNan â€“ An Absolute Gem in NYC!
Iâ€™ve been to JiangNan so many times, and it never disappoints! If youâ€™re looking for a restaurant with amazing atmosphere, great service, and high-quality food at a reasonable price, this is the place to go.

For the price youâ€™re payingâ€”around $30 per person (or up to $50 if you go all out)â€”the experience is incredible. At just $30, youâ€™ll already leave feeling satisfied. Compared to most other restaurants in NYC, Iâ€™d consider this a great dealâ€”either cheap or at least standard pricing for the quality you get.

The food presentation is top-tier, making every dish not just delicious but visually stunning. Youâ€™re getting beautifully plated food that looks high-endâ€”without the crazy price tag. And letâ€™s talk about the tasteâ€”itâ€™s fantastic, definitely above average compared to most places.

The staff is insanely friendly and attentive, always making sure you're well taken care of. Their professionalism and well-dressed appearance add to the restaurantâ€™s high-end feelâ€”without the high-end price tag.

The atmosphere is really something special, making it an ideal spot for both casual outings and special occasions. Itâ€™s elevated yet welcoming, which is rare to find at this price point.

And if you're still on the fenceâ€”just look at my photos! You know you want it. Doesn't that look delicious? ğŸ˜†

Definitely recommend a visit if youâ€™re in NYCâ€”100% worth it!

Oh my gosh!!! We came here after our good friend recommended it from TikTok and also other industry friends mentioned this place so we had to try it while we are visiting NY for a work convention. The food? EXCEPTIONAL. The ambience? BEAUTIFUL. The service? Quick and efficient. Definitely would come back again and get the same dishes! Incredibly great food, 10/10!
food is okay, waiters are able to speak Chinese, not very spicy to a Chinese person, but a pleasant experience there if missing hometown food

The food tastes absolutely delicious, the waiters are very attentive and nice. The atmosphere is dim and quiet. A great restaurant to go for a date. We order the kimchi cheese fried rice, the crispy fish, pork and crab soup dumplings. They also gave us free macaroons. Thanks so much for having us!

This place was amazing, duck was high quality and the service was great. You order thru an ipad and the food comes out fairly quick. I recommend this place for their duck, and would definitely come back to try their other dishes!
